contextNodes.label: Daytona
contextNodes.description: Cloud-native development environment platform providing secure, isolated sandboxes for code execution and development workflows. Offers CLI, web dashboard, and programmatic APIs for managing containerized development environments with real-time monitoring and collaboration features.
contextNodes.stats: Primarily Go-based backend services with TypeScript/React frontend, Python/Ruby SDKs, and Astro documentation site
contextNodes.purpose: Provides secure, isolated development sandboxes for safe code execution and collaborative development workflows.

contextNodes.label: Developers
contextNodes.description: Software developers using CLI commands and web dashboard to create, manage, and execute code in secure sandboxes via REST APIs and SSH connections

contextNodes.label: AI Agents
contextNodes.description: AI systems using TypeScript, Python, Go, and Ruby SDKs to programmatically create sandboxes and execute AI-generated code via REST APIs

contextNodes.label: Platform Operators
contextNodes.description: DevOps teams deploying Daytona infrastructure using Docker Compose and Kubernetes manifests, monitoring system health via OpenTelemetry metrics

contextNodes.label: Organization Admins
contextNodes.description: Team leads managing organization settings, user permissions, and resource quotas through web dashboard REST API endpoints

contextNodes.label: Container Registry
contextNodes.description: OCI/Docker registries accessed via Docker Registry HTTP API v2 for pulling sandbox base images and storing custom environments

contextNodes.label: PostgreSQL Database
contextNodes.description: Primary relational database accessed via PostgreSQL wire protocol for persisting sandbox metadata, user data, and organization settings

contextNodes.label: Redis Cache
contextNodes.description: In-memory data store accessed via Redis Serialization Protocol (RESP) for session management, caching, and real-time data

contextNodes.label: Kubernetes API
contextNodes.description: Container orchestration platform accessed via client-go library and Kubernetes REST API for sandbox deployment and resource management

contextNodes.label: Monitoring Backends
contextNodes.description: Observability platforms like Grafana and New Relic receiving OpenTelemetry metrics and traces via OTLP protocol

contextNodes.label: Git Providers
contextNodes.description: GitHub, GitLab, and other Git services accessed via Git protocol and REST APIs for repository cloning and version control operations

systemNodes.label: Core API Service
systemNodes.description: NestJS-based REST API service providing sandbox lifecycle management, user authentication, and organization management. Exposes OpenAPI-documented endpoints for sandbox creation, execution, and monitoring. Integrates with Redis for caching and PostgreSQL for persistence.
systemNodes.purpose: NestJS-based REST API service providing sandbox lifecycle management, user authentication, and organization management. Exposes OpenAPI-documented endpoints for sandbox creation, execution, and monitoring. Integrates with Redis for caching and PostgreSQL for persistence.

systemNodes.label: Daytona CLI
systemNodes.description: Go-based command-line interface providing developers with sandbox management capabilities. Implements authentication flows, workspace operations, and MCP (Model Context Protocol) server functionality. Includes auto-completion and comprehensive documentation generation.
systemNodes.stats: Go - 50+ files - CLI with MCP support
systemNodes.purpose: Go-based command-line interface providing developers with sandbox management capabilities. Implements authentication flows, workspace operations, and MCP (Model Context Protocol) server functionality. Includes auto-completion and comprehensive documentation generation.

systemNodes.label: Daytona Daemon
systemNodes.description: Go-based background service managing sandbox infrastructure and container orchestration. Handles sandbox provisioning, resource allocation, and lifecycle events. Communicates with the API service and provides toolbox API endpoints.
systemNodes.purpose: Go-based background service managing sandbox infrastructure and container orchestration. Handles sandbox provisioning, resource allocation, and lifecycle events. Communicates with the API service and provides toolbox API endpoints.

systemNodes.label: Web Dashboard
systemNodes.description: React-based single-page application providing web interface for sandbox management. Built with Vite and Tailwind CSS, offering real-time monitoring, organization management, and user settings. Consumes the Core API Service via TypeScript SDK.
systemNodes.purpose: React-based single-page application providing web interface for sandbox management. Built with Vite and Tailwind CSS, offering real-time monitoring, organization management, and user settings. Consumes the Core API Service via TypeScript SDK.

systemNodes.label: Proxy Gateway
systemNodes.description: Go-based HTTP proxy service routing traffic between sandboxes and external clients. Handles request forwarding, load balancing, and connection management for sandbox access. Deployed as containerized service.
systemNodes.purpose: Go-based HTTP proxy service routing traffic between sandboxes and external clients. Handles request forwarding, load balancing, and connection management for sandbox access. Deployed as containerized service.

systemNodes.label: Sandbox Runner
systemNodes.description: Go-based execution environment managing code execution within sandboxes. Handles process isolation, resource limits, and execution monitoring. Provides APIs for code execution, file operations, and environment management.
systemNodes.purpose: Go-based execution environment managing code execution within sandboxes. Handles process isolation, resource limits, and execution monitoring. Provides APIs for code execution, file operations, and environment management.

systemNodes.label: SSH Gateway
systemNodes.description: Go-based SSH server providing secure shell access to sandboxes. Handles authentication, session management, and terminal multiplexing. Enables developers to access sandbox environments via SSH protocol.
systemNodes.purpose: Go-based SSH server providing secure shell access to sandboxes. Handles authentication, session management, and terminal multiplexing. Enables developers to access sandbox environments via SSH protocol.

systemNodes.label: Snapshot Manager
systemNodes.description: Go-based service managing sandbox snapshots and state persistence. Handles snapshot creation, restoration, and lifecycle management. Provides APIs for snapshot operations and integrates with storage backends.
systemNodes.purpose: Go-based service managing sandbox snapshots and state persistence. Handles snapshot creation, restoration, and lifecycle management. Provides APIs for snapshot operations and integrates with storage backends.

systemNodes.label: Observability Collector
systemNodes.description: OpenTelemetry collector with custom exporters for metrics and tracing. Aggregates telemetry data from all services and exports to monitoring backends. Built with Go and custom OTEL components.
systemNodes.purpose: OpenTelemetry collector with custom exporters for metrics and tracing. Aggregates telemetry data from all services and exports to monitoring backends. Built with Go and custom OTEL components.

systemNodes.label: Documentation Site
systemNodes.description: Astro-based static site generator for project documentation. Includes API reference generation, CLI documentation, and user guides. Features automated content updates from API schemas and CLI help text.
systemNodes.purpose: Astro-based static site generator for project documentation. Includes API reference generation, CLI documentation, and user guides. Features automated content updates from API schemas and CLI help text.

systemNodes.label: Multi-Language SDKs
systemNodes.description: Client libraries for TypeScript, Python, Go, and Ruby providing programmatic access to Daytona APIs. Include both synchronous and asynchronous variants, with auto-generated API clients from OpenAPI specifications.
systemNodes.purpose: Client libraries for TypeScript, Python, Go, and Ruby providing programmatic access to Daytona APIs. Include both synchronous and asynchronous variants, with auto-generated API clients from OpenAPI specifications.

systemNodes.label: Generated API Clients
systemNodes.description: Auto-generated API client libraries for multiple languages created from OpenAPI specifications. Includes both main API and toolbox API clients with synchronous and asynchronous variants for Python.
systemNodes.purpose: Auto-generated API client libraries for multiple languages created from OpenAPI specifications. Includes both main API and toolbox API clients with synchronous and asynchronous variants for Python.

moduleNodes.label: sandbox-management
moduleNodes.description: NestJS-based REST API module exposing OpenAPI-documented endpoints for sandbox lifecycle management. Implements TypeORM entities for PostgreSQL persistence and integrates with Kafka for event streaming. Uses gRPC clients to communicate with runner services for container orchestration and provides WebSocket connections for real-time sandbox monitoring.
moduleNodes.architecture: Follows NestJS modular architecture with controllers exposing REST endpoints, services handling business logic, and TypeORM repositories for data persistence. Uses dependency injection for service composition and implements event-driven patterns with Kafka publishers. Integrates with external runner services via gRPC for container management.

technicalSpecs.title: Framework
technicalSpecs.details: NestJS with TypeScript and OpenAPI documentation

technicalSpecs.title: Database
technicalSpecs.details: PostgreSQL via TypeORM with entity relationships

technicalSpecs.title: Communication
technicalSpecs.details: gRPC clients for runner services, Kafka for events

technicalSpecs.title: Authentication
technicalSpecs.details: JWT and API key strategies via Passport.js

keyDecisions: TypeORM for PostgreSQL ORM with entity relationships
gRPC client integration for runner service communication
Kafka event streaming for sandbox state changes
moduleNodes.purpose: Manages complete sandbox lifecycle from creation through execution to termination with real-time monitoring capabilities.

howItWorks.overview: Exposes REST endpoints for sandbox CRUD operations while maintaining state synchronization with container runtime via gRPC.

workflow.description: Receive sandbox creation request via REST API with authentication
Validate organization quotas and permissions through organization service
Persist sandbox entity to PostgreSQL via TypeORM repository
Send container creation request to runner service via gRPC client
Publish sandbox state events to Kafka for audit logging

moduleNodes.label: organization-management
moduleNodes.description: NestJS module providing multi-tenant organization management with role-based access control (RBAC) and resource quotas. Implements TypeORM entities for PostgreSQL persistence of organizations, users, roles, and invitations. Exposes REST endpoints for organization CRUD operations, member management, and quota enforcement with OpenAPI documentation.
moduleNodes.architecture: Implements multi-tenant architecture with organization-scoped data isolation using TypeORM entity relationships. Uses NestJS guards for RBAC enforcement and decorators for permission checks. Provides service layer for business logic with repository pattern for data access and event-driven notifications for organization changes.

technicalSpecs.title: Framework
technicalSpecs.details: NestJS with TypeScript and dependency injection

technicalSpecs.title: Database
technicalSpecs.details: PostgreSQL with TypeORM for multi-tenant data isolation

technicalSpecs.title: Authorization
technicalSpecs.details: Custom RBAC guards with organization-scoped permissions

technicalSpecs.title: Events
technicalSpecs.details: EventEmitter2 for organization lifecycle notifications

keyDecisions: TypeORM entity relationships for multi-tenant data isolation
Custom NestJS guards for organization-level RBAC
Event-driven architecture for organization state changes
moduleNodes.purpose: Enables multi-tenant SaaS architecture with organization-scoped resource management and role-based permissions.

howItWorks.overview: Manages organization lifecycle with RBAC enforcement and quota tracking across all tenant resources.

workflow.description: Authenticate user and extract organization context from JWT token
Apply organization access guards to verify membership and permissions
Execute business logic with organization-scoped data queries via TypeORM
Enforce resource quotas before allowing resource creation operations
Emit organization events for audit logging and downstream processing

moduleNodes.label: auth-module
moduleNodes.description: NestJS authentication module implementing JWT and API key strategies via Passport.js. Provides multiple authentication guards including combined auth, health check bypass, and system action authorization. Includes failed authentication tracking with Redis-based rate limiting and context extraction utilities for request processing.
moduleNodes.architecture: Uses Passport.js strategies for JWT and API key authentication with NestJS guard composition. Implements guard hierarchy with OR logic for flexible authentication requirements. Integrates Redis for failed authentication tracking and provides context extraction utilities for downstream services.

technicalSpecs.title: Framework
technicalSpecs.details: NestJS with Passport.js authentication strategies

technicalSpecs.title: Tokens
technicalSpecs.details: JWT with RS256 signing and API key validation

technicalSpecs.title: Rate Limiting
technicalSpecs.details: Redis-based failed authentication tracking

technicalSpecs.title: Guards
technicalSpecs.details: Composable NestJS guards with OR logic support

keyDecisions: Passport.js strategies for pluggable authentication methods
Guard composition with OR logic for flexible auth requirements
Redis-based rate limiting for brute force protection
moduleNodes.purpose: Secures API endpoints with multiple authentication strategies and prevents brute force attacks through rate limiting.

howItWorks.overview: Validates incoming requests using JWT tokens or API keys with rate limiting for failed attempts.

workflow.description: Extract authentication credentials from request headers or cookies
Validate credentials using appropriate Passport.js strategy (JWT/API key)
Check Redis for failed authentication attempts and apply rate limiting
Extract user and organization context for downstream authorization
Apply specialized guards for system actions and health checks

moduleNodes.label: audit-system
moduleNodes.description: NestJS audit logging system with dual storage adapters for TypeORM (PostgreSQL) and OpenSearch. Implements Kafka-based event publishing for distributed audit log processing and provides REST endpoints for audit log querying with pagination. Uses NestJS interceptors and decorators for automatic audit trail generation across API operations.
moduleNodes.architecture: Implements adapter pattern for pluggable storage backends (PostgreSQL/OpenSearch) with Kafka publisher for event streaming. Uses NestJS interceptors for automatic audit capture and decorators for sensitive data masking. Provides repository pattern for audit log persistence and REST API for audit log retrieval with filtering.

technicalSpecs.title: Framework
technicalSpecs.details: NestJS with interceptors and custom decorators

technicalSpecs.title: Storage
technicalSpecs.details: Dual adapters for PostgreSQL (TypeORM) and OpenSearch

technicalSpecs.title: Events
technicalSpecs.details: Kafka producer for distributed audit log streaming

technicalSpecs.title: API
technicalSpecs.details: REST endpoints with OpenAPI documentation and pagination

keyDecisions: Adapter pattern for multiple storage backends (TypeORM/OpenSearch)
Kafka event streaming for distributed audit processing
NestJS interceptors for automatic audit trail capture
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides comprehensive audit logging for compliance and security monitoring across all system operations.

howItWorks.overview: Automatically captures API operations via interceptors and stores audit logs in multiple backends with Kafka distribution.

workflow.description: Intercept API requests using NestJS interceptors with audit decorators
Extract actor context and operation metadata from request
Persist audit log to primary storage via TypeORM or OpenSearch adapter
Publish audit events to Kafka topic for distributed processing
Provide REST endpoints for audit log querying with pagination support

moduleNodes.label: cli-commands
moduleNodes.description: Implements Cobra CLI framework commands for workspace lifecycle management including create, start, stop, and delete operations. Exposes subcommands via cobra.Command structs with flag parsing and validation. Integrates with Daytona API through HTTP REST calls for sandbox orchestration. Provides auto-completion support through Cobra's built-in completion system.
moduleNodes.architecture: Uses Cobra command tree pattern with root command and nested subcommands for workspace operations. Each command implements cobra.Command interface with RunE functions that validate flags and execute business logic. Commands communicate with Daytona API server via HTTP REST client calls. Auto-completion is generated through Cobra's completion command integration.

technicalSpecs.title: CLI Framework
technicalSpecs.details: Cobra with Viper for configuration management

technicalSpecs.title: Command Pattern
technicalSpecs.details: Nested subcommands with flag validation

technicalSpecs.title: Output Format
technicalSpecs.details: Structured terminal output with color support

technicalSpecs.title: Completion
technicalSpecs.details: Bash/Zsh/Fish shell completion via Cobra

keyDecisions: Chose Cobra framework for standardized CLI patterns and auto-completion support
Implemented command validation at CLI layer before API calls to provide immediate feedback
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides command-line interface for developers to manage Daytona workspaces and sandboxes.

howItWorks.overview: Cobra commands parse CLI arguments and flags, then delegate to API client for remote operations.

workflow.description: Parse command line arguments and flags using Cobra framework
Validate required parameters and authenticate user session
Execute API calls through HTTP REST client to Daytona server
Format and display response data to user terminal

moduleNodes.label: cli-auth
moduleNodes.description: Handles OAuth2 authentication flows for CLI users including device code flow and token refresh mechanisms. Stores JWT tokens in local filesystem using secure file permissions (0600). Implements token validation and automatic refresh using OAuth2 refresh tokens. Provides session management for persistent authentication across CLI commands.
moduleNodes.architecture: Implements OAuth2 device code flow pattern for CLI authentication without browser redirect. Uses filesystem-based token storage with JSON serialization for persistence. Token refresh is handled automatically on API calls with expired tokens. Session state is maintained in memory during CLI command execution.

technicalSpecs.title: Auth Flow
technicalSpecs.details: OAuth2 device code flow for headless authentication

technicalSpecs.title: Token Storage
technicalSpecs.details: Local filesystem with 0600 permissions

technicalSpecs.title: Token Format
technicalSpecs.details: JWT with automatic refresh capability

technicalSpecs.title: Session Management
technicalSpecs.details: In-memory state with persistent token storage

keyDecisions: Chose OAuth2 device code flow for headless CLI authentication without browser dependency
Implemented local token storage with secure file permissions for session persistence
moduleNodes.purpose: Manages user authentication and session persistence for CLI operations.

howItWorks.overview: Implements OAuth2 device code flow for CLI authentication with automatic token refresh and local persistence.

workflow.description: Initiate OAuth2 device code flow with authorization server
Display device code and verification URL to user
Poll authorization server for token exchange completion
Store JWT access and refresh tokens in local filesystem with secure permissions
Automatically refresh expired tokens on subsequent API calls

moduleNodes.label: mcp-server
moduleNodes.description: Implements Model Context Protocol (MCP) server functionality exposing Daytona workspace operations as structured tools for AI agents. Serves MCP protocol over stdio transport with JSON-RPC 2.0 message format. Provides tools for workspace creation, management, and code analysis through standardized MCP tool definitions. Enables AI assistants to interact with Daytona sandboxes programmatically.
moduleNodes.architecture: Implements MCP server specification using JSON-RPC 2.0 over stdio transport. Tool definitions are registered as MCP capabilities with structured input/output schemas. Each tool maps to Daytona API operations through internal client calls. Server handles MCP protocol negotiation and capability advertisement to connecting AI agents.

technicalSpecs.title: Protocol
technicalSpecs.details: Model Context Protocol (MCP) over stdio

technicalSpecs.title: Transport
technicalSpecs.details: JSON-RPC 2.0 message format

technicalSpecs.title: Tool Schema
technicalSpecs.details: Structured input/output definitions for workspace operations

technicalSpecs.title: Capability Advertisement
technicalSpecs.details: MCP server capabilities with tool discovery

keyDecisions: Implemented MCP over stdio transport for simple AI agent integration without network complexity
Mapped Daytona workspace operations to MCP tool definitions for structured AI interaction
moduleNodes.purpose: Exposes Daytona functionality to AI agents through standardized Model Context Protocol interface.

howItWorks.overview: Serves MCP protocol over stdio, translating AI agent tool calls into Daytona API operations.

workflow.description: Listen for MCP JSON-RPC messages on stdin
Parse tool invocation requests and validate parameters
Execute corresponding Daytona API calls through internal client
Format API responses as MCP tool results and send via stdout

moduleNodes.label: api-client-integration
moduleNodes.description: Provides HTTP REST client for communicating with Daytona API server using Go's net/http package. Implements request/response serialization with JSON encoding and automatic authentication header injection. Handles API versioning through URL path prefixes and provides typed Go structs for API data models. Includes retry logic and error handling for network failures.
moduleNodes.stats: Go - HTTP client - REST API integration
moduleNodes.architecture: Uses Go's net/http.Client with custom transport for authentication header injection. API models are defined as Go structs with JSON tags for serialization. Client methods correspond to REST endpoints with typed request/response handling. Implements exponential backoff retry pattern for transient network failures.

technicalSpecs.title: HTTP Client
technicalSpecs.details: Go net/http.Client with custom transport

technicalSpecs.title: Serialization
technicalSpecs.details: JSON encoding/decoding with struct tags

technicalSpecs.title: Authentication
technicalSpecs.details: Bearer token injection via HTTP headers

technicalSpecs.title: Error Handling
technicalSpecs.details: Exponential backoff retry with structured error responses

keyDecisions: Used Go's standard net/http package for HTTP client implementation over third-party libraries
Implemented typed API models as Go structs for compile-time safety and IDE support
moduleNodes.purpose: Abstracts HTTP communication with Daytona API server for CLI operations.

howItWorks.overview: Wraps HTTP REST calls to Daytona API with authentication, serialization, and error handling.

workflow.description: Construct HTTP request with JSON payload and authentication headers
Execute HTTP call with retry logic for transient failures
Parse JSON response into typed Go structs
Handle API errors and return structured error responses

moduleNodes.label: daemon-core
moduleNodes.description: Go-based daemon service that exposes gRPC endpoints for sandbox lifecycle management and container orchestration. Implements the main daemon server process that handles sandbox provisioning requests via protobuf messages. Manages background workers for resource allocation and communicates with container runtimes through Docker API and containerd interfaces. Provides HTTP REST endpoints for health checks and metrics collection using Prometheus format.
moduleNodes.stats: Go - 15 files - gRPC server with HTTP endpoints
moduleNodes.architecture: Follows a layered service architecture with gRPC transport layer, business logic handlers, and container runtime adapters. Uses dependency injection pattern for service composition and implements graceful shutdown handling with context cancellation. Employs worker pool pattern for concurrent sandbox operations and maintains state through in-memory caches with periodic persistence to disk.

technicalSpecs.title: Transport
technicalSpecs.details: gRPC with protobuf serialization

technicalSpecs.title: Container Runtime
technicalSpecs.details: Docker API and containerd client

technicalSpecs.title: Metrics
technicalSpecs.details: Prometheus HTTP endpoint on /metrics

technicalSpecs.title: Concurrency
technicalSpecs.details: Worker pools with context-based cancellation

keyDecisions: gRPC chosen over REST for high-performance inter-service communication with type-safe protobuf contracts
Separate worker pools implemented to isolate sandbox provisioning from lifecycle management operations
Context-based cancellation used throughout to ensure proper resource cleanup during shutdown
moduleNodes.purpose: Serves as the central orchestration service for managing sandbox infrastructure and container lifecycle operations.

howItWorks.overview: Daemon core starts gRPC server and HTTP metrics endpoint, then processes sandbox management requests through dedicated handler goroutines.

workflow.description: Initialize gRPC server with sandbox management service handlers on configured port
Start background worker pools for sandbox provisioning and lifecycle operations
Process incoming gRPC requests by routing to appropriate service handlers
Execute container operations via Docker API or containerd client interfaces
Update sandbox state in memory cache and emit lifecycle events to subscribers

moduleNodes.label: daemon-pkg
moduleNodes.description: Go package library providing core daemon functionality including toolbox process management and Python REPL worker integration. Implements REPLWorker class in Python for interactive code execution within sandbox environments. Exposes toolbox API endpoints for process lifecycle management and provides interpreter services for development workflows. Handles process spawning, monitoring, and cleanup through structured logging and error handling.
moduleNodes.stats: Go/Python - 8 files - toolbox API with REPL worker
moduleNodes.architecture: Implements a hybrid Go/Python architecture where Go handles HTTP API endpoints and process management while Python provides REPL execution environments. Uses factory pattern for creating language-specific interpreters and maintains process pools for efficient resource utilization. Employs structured logging with JSON format and implements graceful process termination through signal handling.

technicalSpecs.title: API Framework
technicalSpecs.details: HTTP REST with Gorilla mux router

technicalSpecs.title: Process Management
technicalSpecs.details: Python subprocess with signal handling

technicalSpecs.title: Logging
technicalSpecs.details: Structured JSON logs via logrus

technicalSpecs.title: REPL Integration
technicalSpecs.details: Python interpreter with globals management

keyDecisions: Python REPL worker chosen to provide interactive development capabilities within Go-managed sandbox processes
Hybrid language approach allows leveraging Python's REPL capabilities while maintaining Go's performance for API handling
Process pool pattern implemented to reduce startup overhead for frequent REPL session creation
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides reusable components and toolbox services for sandbox process management and interactive development environments.

howItWorks.overview: Daemon packages expose HTTP REST endpoints for toolbox operations and manage Python REPL worker processes for interactive code execution.

workflow.description: Register HTTP handlers for toolbox API endpoints using Gorilla mux router
Initialize Python REPL worker process pool with configured interpreter instances
Handle incoming toolbox requests by routing to appropriate process management functions
Spawn or reuse Python REPL worker processes for code execution requests
Monitor process health and perform cleanup on termination or timeout

moduleNodes.label: dashboard-components
moduleNodes.description: React component library implementing UI widgets for sandbox management dashboard. Provides data tables with TanStack Table for sandboxes, snapshots, and audit logs with real-time filtering and bulk operations. Implements shadcn/ui design system components with Tailwind CSS styling and Framer Motion animations. Integrates with TypeScript SDK via React Query for API state management and real-time updates.
moduleNodes.architecture: Component-based architecture using React functional components with TypeScript. Implements compound component pattern for complex data tables with separate header, row, and action components. Uses React Query for server state management and optimistic updates. Follows atomic design principles with base components, composite widgets, and page-level layouts.

technicalSpecs.title: UI Framework
technicalSpecs.details: React 18 with TypeScript and shadcn/ui components

technicalSpecs.title: State Management
technicalSpecs.details: React Query for server state, React Hook Form for form state

technicalSpecs.title: Styling
technicalSpecs.details: Tailwind CSS with CSS-in-JS via clsx utility

technicalSpecs.title: Animation
technicalSpecs.details: Framer Motion for micro-interactions and transitions

keyDecisions: TanStack Table for complex data grids with sorting, filtering, and pagination
shadcn/ui component library for consistent design system implementation
React Query for server state caching and real-time synchronization
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides reusable React UI components for sandbox management, organization administration, and system monitoring interfaces.

howItWorks.overview: React components consume API data through React Query hooks and render interactive UI elements with real-time updates.

workflow.description: Components receive props from parent pages with initial data and event handlers
React Query hooks fetch and cache API data with automatic background refetching
TanStack Table manages sorting, filtering, and pagination state for data grids
User interactions trigger optimistic updates and API mutations via React Query
Real-time updates propagate through React Query cache invalidation and refetching

moduleNodes.label: dashboard-pages
moduleNodes.description: React page components implementing complete dashboard views for sandbox management application. Orchestrates multiple dashboard components to create full-page interfaces for sandbox listing, organization management, billing, and user settings. Uses React Router for client-side navigation and implements protected routes with authentication guards. Integrates with TypeScript SDK through dashboard library utilities for API operations and state management.
moduleNodes.architecture: Page-level React components following container-presenter pattern. Each page acts as a container orchestrating multiple dashboard components and managing page-specific state. Uses React Router for declarative routing with nested routes and route guards. Implements layout components for consistent page structure and navigation.

technicalSpecs.details: React Router v6 with nested routes and route guards

technicalSpecs.details: React Query hooks with prefetching and cache management

technicalSpecs.details: React Helmet Async for dynamic meta tags and titles

technicalSpecs.title: Authentication
technicalSpecs.details: Context-based auth guards with role-based access control

Container-presenter pattern separating page logic from UI components
Protected route guards using authentication context and role-based access

howItWorks.overview: Page components compose dashboard components and manage page-level state, routing, and authentication.

workflow.description: React Router matches URL paths to page components with authentication checks
Page components initialize required data fetching through React Query hooks
Pages compose multiple dashboard components passing down props and event handlers
User navigation triggers React Router transitions with route guards and data prefetching

moduleNodes.label: dashboard-lib
moduleNodes.description: TypeScript utility library providing shared functionality for React dashboard application. Implements API client wrappers around TypeScript SDK with React Query integration for caching and optimistic updates. Provides authentication context, form validation schemas with Zod, and utility functions for data formatting and error handling. Includes custom React hooks for common dashboard operations like sandbox management and organization administration.
moduleNodes.architecture: Utility-first architecture with custom React hooks and context providers. Implements facade pattern wrapping TypeScript SDK with React-specific functionality. Uses Zod for runtime type validation and form schema definition. Provides centralized error handling and loading state management through custom hooks.

technicalSpecs.details: Zod schemas for runtime type checking and form validation

technicalSpecs.details: React Query with custom hooks for API state

Custom React hooks abstracting common API operations and state management
Context providers for global state like authentication and organization selection
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides shared utilities, API integrations, and React hooks that support dashboard components and pages.

howItWorks.overview: Library provides React hooks and utilities that wrap TypeScript SDK calls with React Query for state management.

workflow.description: Custom hooks initialize React Query clients with TypeScript SDK configuration
API wrapper functions transform SDK responses into React-friendly data structures
Zod schemas validate API responses and form inputs at runtime
Context providers manage global application state and authentication tokens

moduleNodes.label: proxy-core
moduleNodes.description: Go-based HTTP reverse proxy service that routes incoming requests to sandbox environments using net/http and gorilla/mux router. Implements connection pooling with configurable timeouts and retry logic for upstream sandbox services. Provides health check endpoints via HTTP handlers and integrates with load balancing algorithms for traffic distribution. Exposes metrics via Prometheus client for monitoring proxy performance and request latencies.
moduleNodes.architecture: Implements reverse proxy pattern using Go's net/http.ReverseProxy with custom Director function for request routing. Uses middleware chain architecture with gorilla/mux for request handling, connection pooling, and metrics collection. Maintains upstream target registry with health checking via periodic HTTP probes to sandbox endpoints. Follows graceful shutdown pattern with context cancellation for clean service termination.

technicalSpecs.title: HTTP Server
technicalSpecs.details: net/http with gorilla/mux router on configurable port

technicalSpecs.title: Load Balancing
technicalSpecs.details: Round-robin and least-connections algorithms

technicalSpecs.title: Connection Pool
technicalSpecs.details: HTTP/1.1 keep-alive with 100 max idle connections

technicalSpecs.title: Metrics
technicalSpecs.details: Prometheus histogram for latency and counter for requests

keyDecisions: Used gorilla/mux over standard ServeMux for advanced routing patterns and middleware support
Implemented connection pooling with configurable keep-alive to optimize sandbox communication
Chose Prometheus metrics over custom telemetry for standardized observability
moduleNodes.purpose: Routes external client traffic to appropriate sandbox instances while providing load balancing and connection management.

howItWorks.overview: Receives HTTP requests from external clients and forwards them to appropriate sandbox instances based on routing rules and load balancing policies.

workflow.description: Accept incoming HTTP request and extract routing headers
Query sandbox-management for available target instances
Apply load balancing algorithm to select optimal sandbox endpoint
Forward request via ReverseProxy with connection pooling
Log request metrics to audit-system and emit telemetry

moduleNodes.label: runner-core
moduleNodes.description: Implements a Go-based sandbox execution engine that manages isolated code execution environments using Linux containers and cgroups. Exposes a gRPC API on a configurable port for receiving code execution requests with resource limits and timeout constraints. Integrates with Docker runtime API to create ephemeral containers with restricted filesystem access and network isolation. Monitors process execution through ptrace syscalls and collects stdout/stderr streams via named pipes.
moduleNodes.problemDescription: Module shows no files in directory structure, indicating potential build or discovery issues that may affect code execution capabilities.
moduleNodes.architecture: Follows a layered architecture with gRPC transport layer handling execution requests, a sandbox manager coordinating Docker container lifecycle, and a process monitor tracking resource usage via cgroups. Uses protobuf message serialization for API contracts and implements graceful shutdown patterns with context cancellation. Employs worker pool pattern for concurrent execution requests with configurable queue limits.

technicalSpecs.title: Runtime
technicalSpecs.details: Docker Engine API with containerd backend

keyDecisions: Uses Docker containers instead of native chroot for stronger isolation guarantees
Implements gRPC streaming for real-time stdout/stderr collection during execution

moduleNodes.purpose: Provides secure, isolated code execution environments with configurable resource limits and comprehensive monitoring capabilities.

howItWorks.overview: Receives code execution requests via gRPC, creates isolated Docker containers with resource constraints, and monitors execution while streaming output back to clients.

workflow.description: Accept gRPC execution request with code payload and resource limits
Create Docker container with restricted filesystem and network access
Apply cgroups constraints for memory, CPU, and process limits
Execute code within container while streaming stdout/stderr via named pipes
Collect execution metrics and cleanup container resources on completion

moduleNodes.label: snapshot-core
moduleNodes.description: Implements a gRPC-based snapshot management service that creates and restores filesystem snapshots using copy-on-write semantics. Exposes snapshot lifecycle APIs over HTTP REST endpoints with JSON payloads for external clients. Integrates with storage backends through pluggable driver interfaces supporting local filesystem, S3, and block storage providers. Maintains snapshot metadata in SQLite database with ACID transaction guarantees for state consistency.
moduleNodes.architecture: Follows hexagonal architecture with domain-driven design patterns, separating snapshot business logic from storage adapters. Uses gRPC for internal service communication and HTTP REST for external API exposure. Implements event-driven snapshot lifecycle management with async worker pools for I/O intensive operations. Storage abstraction layer enables pluggable backends through interface-based dependency injection.

technicalSpecs.title: API Protocol
technicalSpecs.details: gRPC with Protocol Buffers and HTTP REST with JSON

technicalSpecs.title: Storage Backend
technicalSpecs.details: Pluggable drivers for filesystem, S3, and block storage

technicalSpecs.title: Metadata Store
technicalSpecs.details: SQLite with WAL mode for concurrent access

technicalSpecs.title: Concurrency
technicalSpecs.details: Worker pools with semaphore-based resource limiting

keyDecisions: gRPC for internal APIs to leverage type safety and performance over HTTP
SQLite for metadata storage to minimize external dependencies while ensuring ACID compliance
Copy-on-write snapshots to optimize storage usage and creation speed
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides reliable sandbox state persistence and restoration capabilities for development environment isolation.

howItWorks.overview: Receives snapshot requests via gRPC/HTTP, orchestrates filesystem operations through storage drivers, and maintains transactional metadata records.

workflow.description: Accept snapshot creation request with sandbox ID and metadata via gRPC
Validate sandbox state and acquire filesystem lock for consistency
Execute copy-on-write snapshot through configured storage driver
Persist snapshot metadata to SQLite with transaction rollback on failure
Emit snapshot lifecycle events to audit system via message queue

moduleNodes.label: otel-exporter
moduleNodes.description: Custom OpenTelemetry exporter component that implements the OTEL Collector's exporter interface to forward telemetry data to external monitoring backends. Uses the OpenTelemetry Collector SDK to register as a plugin component and handles metrics, traces, and logs via OTLP protocol. Implements batching and retry logic for reliable data transmission to backends like Prometheus, Jaeger, and custom HTTP endpoints. Exposes configuration via YAML config files following OTEL Collector's component configuration schema.
moduleNodes.problemDescription: Module directory exists but contains no source files, indicating incomplete implementation or missing code
moduleNodes.architecture: Implements the OpenTelemetry Collector's component.Exporter interface as a plugin that gets loaded at runtime via the collector's component factory pattern. Uses OTEL's pdata package for telemetry data manipulation and consumer interfaces for receiving data from processors. Follows the collector's pipeline architecture where data flows from receivers through processors to exporters via push-based consumption.

technicalSpecs.title: Plugin Interface
technicalSpecs.details: OpenTelemetry Collector component.Exporter interface

technicalSpecs.title: Data Format
technicalSpecs.details: OTLP protocol via pdata package for metrics, traces, and logs

technicalSpecs.title: Configuration
technicalSpecs.details: YAML-based OTEL Collector component configuration

technicalSpecs.title: Transport
technicalSpecs.details: HTTP/gRPC clients for backend communication with TLS support

keyDecisions: Implemented as OTEL Collector plugin rather than standalone service for better integration with existing collector infrastructure
Used OTLP protocol for standardized telemetry data format to ensure compatibility with upstream systems
Implemented custom batching logic to optimize network calls to monitoring backends
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides custom telemetry data export capabilities beyond standard OTEL exporters for specialized monitoring backends.

howItWorks.overview: Registers as an OTEL Collector exporter plugin and consumes telemetry data from the collector pipeline to forward to configured monitoring backends.

workflow.description: Load exporter configuration from OTEL Collector YAML config file specifying backend endpoints and authentication
Register with OTEL Collector component factory during collector startup via plugin interface
Receive telemetry data batches from collector processors via consumer.Metrics/Traces/Logs interfaces
Transform pdata telemetry objects to backend-specific formats and batch for efficient transmission
Send HTTP/gRPC requests to monitoring backends with retry logic and exponential backoff on failures

moduleNodes.label: docs-content
moduleNodes.description: Astro content collections configuration that defines schema validation for documentation pages using Zod. Implements TypeScript-based content type definitions for docs, API references, and guides. Provides structured content management with frontmatter validation and automatic type generation for static site content.
moduleNodes.architecture: Uses Astro's content collections API with Zod schema validation to define content types. Implements declarative content configuration that generates TypeScript types at build time. Provides centralized schema definitions that validate frontmatter fields across all documentation markdown files.

workflow.description: Export collections object with Zod schemas for each content type

moduleNodes.description: Astro build tools and utilities for documentation site generation including content processing scripts and build automation. Generate CLI documentation by parsing help text from command definitions
Write generated content to markdown files in content collections
Trigger Astro rebuild to include new content in static site

moduleNodes.label: typescript-sdk
moduleNodes.description: TypeScript client library providing programmatic access to Daytona APIs through auto-generated OpenAPI clients. Implements both synchronous and asynchronous patterns using native Promise/async-await for sandbox management, filesystem operations, process execution, and computer use automation. Includes WebSocket support for real-time PTY sessions and streaming operations with multipart file transfer capabilities.
moduleNodes.stats: TypeScript - 29 files - OpenAPI client with WebSocket support
moduleNodes.architecture: Built on OpenAPI-generated HTTP clients with custom wrapper classes for each service domain (Sandbox, FileSystem, Process, Git, etc.). Uses native fetch API for HTTP requests and WebSocket API for real-time communication. Implements decorator pattern for OpenTelemetry tracing and utility classes for binary data handling, multipart uploads, and stream processing.

technicalSpecs.details: Native fetch API with OpenAPI-generated types

WebSocket integration for PTY and streaming operations

Service classes wrap OpenAPI clients with domain logic
HTTP requests use fetch API with automatic retry and error handling
WebSocket connections established for PTY and streaming operations

moduleNodes.label: python-sdk
moduleNodes.description: Python client library with both synchronous and asynchronous variants for Daytona API access. Implements asyncio-based async clients and traditional synchronous wrappers using aiohttp for HTTP requests and websockets library for real-time communication. Provides comprehensive sandbox management, filesystem operations, Git integration, LSP server support, and computer use automation with OpenTelemetry instrumentation.
moduleNodes.stats: Python - 56 files - asyncio with sync wrappers
moduleNodes.architecture: Dual-layer architecture with native async implementations in _async module and synchronous wrappers in _sync module that use asyncio.run() internally. Built on OpenAPI-generated Python clients with custom service classes for domain separation. Includes utility modules for deprecation handling, error management, timeout control, and stream processing.

howItWorks.overview: Async-first implementation with sync wrappers that internally use asyncio.run() to bridge synchronous and asynchronous code.

Async clients use aiohttp sessions for HTTP requests
Sync wrappers call async methods via asyncio.run()

moduleNodes.label: main-api-clients
moduleNodes.description: Auto-generated HTTP client libraries from OpenAPI 3.0 specifications using OpenAPI Generator for the main Daytona API. Provides synchronous Python clients via requests library, asynchronous Python clients via aiohttp, Go clients using net/http, and Ruby clients with Faraday. Each client includes typed model classes, API endpoint methods, and configuration objects for authentication and base URL settings.
moduleNodes.architecture: Generated using OpenAPI Generator with language-specific templates that create HTTP client wrappers around REST API endpoints. Python clients use requests/aiohttp for HTTP transport with Pydantic-style model validation. Go clients leverage net/http with struct-based request/response models. Ruby clients use Faraday HTTP client with ActiveModel-style serialization. All clients follow the same pattern of ApiClient base class, endpoint-specific API classes, and typed model objects.

technicalSpecs.title: Generator
technicalSpecs.details: OpenAPI Generator 6.x with custom templates

technicalSpecs.title: Python HTTP
technicalSpecs.details: requests (sync) and aiohttp (async) libraries

technicalSpecs.title: Go HTTP
technicalSpecs.details: net/http standard library with JSON marshaling

technicalSpecs.title: Ruby HTTP
technicalSpecs.details: Faraday gem with ActiveModel serialization

keyDecisions: OpenAPI Generator chosen for consistent multi-language client generation
Separate async/sync Python clients to support both blocking and non-blocking workflows
Shared model definitions across sync/async variants to reduce duplication
moduleNodes.purpose: Provides type-safe HTTP client libraries for consuming the main Daytona API across multiple programming languages.

workflow.description: OpenAPI Generator reads main API specification YAML/JSON
Generate language-specific client code using templates for Python, Go, Ruby
Create typed model classes from OpenAPI schema definitions
Generate API endpoint methods with HTTP request/response handling
Package clients as importable libraries with configuration objects

moduleNodes.label: toolbox-api-clients
moduleNodes.description: Auto-generated HTTP client libraries from OpenAPI specifications for the Daytona Toolbox API using OpenAPI Generator. Provides synchronous and asynchronous Python clients with aiohttp/requests, plus Go clients using net/http. Includes specialized endpoints for LSP operations, Git commands, file system operations, computer vision tasks, and development environment tooling within sandbox containers.
moduleNodes.architecture: Generated from toolbox-specific OpenAPI specifications with endpoint methods for LSP server communication, Git repository operations, file system manipulation, and computer use automation. Python clients use the same requests/aiohttp pattern as main API clients but with toolbox-specific model classes. Go clients follow identical net/http patterns with toolbox endpoint routing. All clients include authentication handling for sandbox-internal API access.
